events.name: Fiber Friends of Falastin
events.description:
Join us for a series of fiber arts meetups in support of Palestine—
Fiber Friends of Falastin
! This is an exploratory social activity for folks who have basic crochet, knitting, sewing, quilting, weaving, embroidery, (and more!) skills, and who are interested in building community at the intersection of textile-making and social movements. 


We have yarn, some crochet hooks, and some scissors to work on a group project in support of Palestine. You are also welcome to bring your own tools and materials, and related projects to work on.


Please note that this is not a workshop designed to teach skills, although you may learn new skills when you come! 
To participate in the crochet activity, you will need to know how to do a chain stitch and a single crochet stitch, which can be learned 
here
.


Masking is always encouraged at Interference Archive. We will provide masks at the door.


Suggested donation: $10


Donations help to keep our events free and our doors open to the public!

events.name: Collections Working Group Meeting
events.description:
Join Collections Management working group for our May monthly meeting, hybrid at the archive and on Zoom. We will be discussing new donation requests, ongoing cataloging projects, and issues in the archive’s collections. New and seasoned volunteers welcome, no prior experience in archives or libraries necessary.


Zoom link: 
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84556756017?pwd=AxmnArDLYM85qrF0Yt10osClt1NQF2.1

events.name: Free Noise
events.description:
An open mic for queer/trans people and their music, poetry and performance. Come one, come all! 


Email 
milesellisor@gmail.com
 to perform.
$5 suggested donation, but pay what you can.


Collected donations will be split between the Archive and 
G.L.I.T.S.
 (Gays & Lesbians Living In A Transgender Society).

events.name: Volunteer Orientation
events.description:
Join us for the next volunteer orientation to learn about getting involved in Interference Archive’s community. You will learn about Interference Archive’s collection of social movement materials, how we work together as a nonhierarchical community archive, and have a chance to meet fellow comrades and volunteers.


This orientation is open to everyone
; established volunteers who want a refresher and to new folks trying to plug into the community. It doesn’t matter whether you’ve shadowed once, have put on 10 exhibitions, or have just been lurking on the newsletter—all are welcome to learn, share, and make things happen through the archive! We hope you leave this orientation with new friends, new contacts to help you do the work you’re passionate about, and a clear sense of Interference Archive’s history, communication channels, and values. Come with your questions and ideas!


Space is limited, 
so please RSVP
 to reserve your spot for this session!


Physical space of the Interference Archive is ADA compliant.

events.name: Digital Privacy and InfoSec Workshop
events.description:
This workshop is an introduction to personal digital privacy and information security practices, and will cover some data management basics, as well. This workshop is open to anyone, regardless of skill, but will have a particular focus on practices most applicable in community organizing, record-keeping, and archival settings. No pre-existing skills or technologies are required. Participants should bring a device with them, as we will be doing some hands-on activities to help them secure their devices and digital footprints. We will cover topics including:


· What information about me is out there?
· Professional vs personal digital identities
· Identifying & removing information from public directories
· Personal communication infosec (emails, phones, social media)
· Privacy considerations for documenting protests / actions
· Securing and encrypting personal devices and files
· Best practices for file-naming, data backup, and metadata
Because this workshop is hands-on, it has a cap of 25 participants – please register ahead of time!


This workshop is in collaboration with the 
Archival Technologies Lab
 and lead by a facilitator with 9+ years of experience. Please RSVP 
here
.

events.name: Education Reading Group
events.description:
The Education Reading Group is a place where we plan to share and discuss readings about transformative teaching, political pedagogy, engaging education, and the like.


We will be meeting at 
8 pm on Tuesday May 13th
 to read
 
“Bloodchild”
 
by Octavia Butler. It is the titular story from the collection “Bloodchild and Other Stories,” a pdf is here: 
Bloodchild


If you have the book and want to read more stories from the collection feel free, but it’s not necessary!


Here is the jitsi link for the meeting: 
Jitsi

events.name: Drawn Together
events.description:
Join us for a night of drawing and mark-making! Please 
register on Eventbrite
.


At Drawn Together, we provide prompts and materials for you to experiment and explore with your visual art-making practice, all without the pressure of having to do it well.


Because of this one-night partnership, we’ll also have access to Interference Archive’s materials, which we’ll be using as part of our inspiration.


The mission of Interference Archive is to explore the relationship between cultural production and social movements. This work manifests in an open stacks archival collection, publications, a study center, and public programs including exhibitions, workshops, talks, and screenings, all of which encourage critical and creative engagement with the rich history of social movements.


Come for the art-making, stay for a collection of visual media related to the history of activism and social movements around the world!


Timing:
 Doors at 7. Come early to save your seat! Games begin at 7:30.


Supplies:
 Pencils and paper will be provided, though you’re encouraged to bring your own supplies if you’d like.

events.name: Zine Club
events.description: New month, new zine club! This is an informal gathering with some materials provided (paper, scraps, scissors) but anything you want to bring to work with is very welcome. We’ll be making mini one-cut zines around topics of your choice with a bit of brainstorming built in. Come make friends, make a zine, trade a zine.

events.name: Know Your Rights Propaganda Party
events.description:
We keep us safe.
 Join us Sunday, June 1 from 2-6pm to mass produce multilingual know your rights materials like how to watch out for ICE, how to keep yourself safe during a police raid, and how you can intervene as a bystander.


Materials will be available for you to make, take, and distribute within your own communities. Come hang out, print materials, fold zines, and be in community with others as we educate and empower each other.


While this event is free, your donations cover our material costs. 
The mass distribution of materials is not free. Interference Archive is completely volunteer-run and on a shoestring operational budget. Please consider donating to our 
Know Your Rights Propaganda Party fund
 or donating any of the following materials:




blank canvas tote bags


blank t-shirts (all sizes)


screen-printing inks


11″ x 17″ white paper for riso printing (smooth, uncoated)


1.5”, 2” or 2.25” button making supplies




If you are able to donate a material, please dm us on instagram (@interferencearchive) to coordinate a drop off time (by May 18). We appreciate your support! Mutual aid forever.


What is a propaganda party?
 


A propaganda party is where people like you come together to create and distribute material to be “propagated.” While propaganda often has a negative connotation, here we are reclaiming the term and using it to mean mass-education of our community in the face of rising fascism.














Nosotros nos mantenemos a salvo. 
Únase a nosotros el domingo 1 de junio de 2 a 6 p.m. para producir en masa materiales multilingües para conocer sus derechos, cómo tener cuidado y vista contra ICE, cómo mantenerse seguro durante una redada policial y cómo puede intervenir como espectador.


Habrá materiales disponibles para que usted los fabrique, los lleve y los distribuya dentro de sus propias comunidades. Venga a pasar el rato, imprima materiales, doble revistas y forme comunidad con otros mientras nos educamos y empoderamos unos a otros.


Aunque este evento es gratuito, sus donaciones cubren nuestros costos de material. La distribución masiva de materiales no es gratuita. Interference Archive está gestionado completamente por voluntarios y tiene un presupuesto operativo limitado. Por favor, considere hacer una donación a nuestro 
fondo para la Conoce tus Derechos Fiesta de Propaganda
 o donar cualquiera de los siguientes materiales:






bolsas de lona en blanco


camisetas en blanco (todas las tallas)


tintas de serigrafía


Papel blanco de 11″ x 17″ para impresión riso (liso, sin recubrimiento)


Suministros para hacer botones de 1,5”, 2” o 2,25”






Si puedes donar materiales, envíenos un mensaje privado (@interferencearchive – instagram) para coordinar la hora de entrega (antes del 18 de mayo). ¡Apreciamos su apoyo! Ayuda mutua para siempre.


¿Qué es una fiesta de propaganda?


Una fiesta de propaganda es donde personas como usted se reúnen para crear y distribuir material para “propagarlo”. Si bien la propaganda tiene una connotación negativa muchas veces, aquí estamos reclamando el término y usándolo para referirse a la educación masiva de nuestra comunidad frente al creciente fascismo.

events.name: Intro to Self-Defense Workshop
events.description:
Led by Grey from 
Pop Gym
, we’ll be covering the basics: stretching, conditioning, technique, and theory, with the hope that participants will leave with some super useful foundations that they can add to their self-defense toolkits.
Mix that in with movement and pad-hitting and you’ll have an accessible and confidence-boosting good time for all. This workshop is great for beginners, meant to share some simple-to-pick-up techniques that you can practice on your own or with friends!


Grey
 (He/Him, They/Them) has been an instructor with Pop Gym since 2017, and has been co-organizing and leading self-defense workshops in NYC since 2015. They have a background Tae-Kwon-Do, as well as Muay Thai, Boxing, and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. They enjoy creating spaces in which participants can better learn to understand their self-defense abilities and brainstorming individual and collective ways we can defend ourselves and our communities.


Registration
 is required.


Interference Archive is ADA accessible and on the ground floor. There are two single-stall all gender ADA-accessible bathrooms. Masks are encouraged, but not required (and we usually have some available).

events.name: Dark Side of Goth
events.description:
As the goth subculture enjoys a renaissance thanks to social media, we’ll be reflecting on the subculture’s longstanding issues using fascist imagery and Nazi uniforms, ongoing issues of racism, and its growing objectification of women in digital spaces.


We’ll begin with a lecture on the history of the issues within the subculture and move into an open discussion.
